subject: Retrieve port info for systems service
commitMessage:
Retrieve port info for systems service

In systems.hpp for Serialconsole, SSH service-enabled and its Port
number info is hardcoded. Same for IPMI service-enabled info is also
hardcoded.

Implementation:

 SSH:
  check for obmc-console-ssh@2200.service service is enable or not, and
  yes then, on which port number. Retrieve service-related information
  and pass that into DMTF for "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/".

 IPMI:-
  check for phosphor-ipmi-net@eth0.socket service is enable or not, and
  pass that info DMTF for "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/".

Tested:
 Manually tested on the Witherspoon system, there is no change in output.
 Run Redfish validator. No error found.

Before:

"SerialConsole": {
  "IPMI": {
    "ServiceEnabled": true
  },
  "MaxConcurrentSessions": 15,
  "SSH": {
    "HotKeySequenceDisplay": "Press ~. to exit console",
    "Port": 2200,
    "ServiceEnabled": true
  }
}

After:

 Note: SSH Info retrieve via Dbus ListUnit API

"SerialConsole": {
  "IPMI": {
    "ServiceEnabled": true
  },
  "MaxConcurrentSessions": 15,
  "SSH": {
    "HotKeySequenceDisplay": "Press ~. to exit console",
    "Port": 2200,
    "ServiceEnabled": true
  }
}

Signed-off-by: Abhishek Patel <Abhishek.Patel@ibm.com>
Change-Id: I70009ee785aab3ca4a61fe0d96fbc5b340831647

nit:  technically this should be std::array, to ensure we're not allocating memory pre main().  If you end up doing another patch, please fix this at the same time.

getPortInfo can't ever error out?  That seems wrong.
that we handle inside that method. we are passing asyncResp into it too.
Please follow the pattern we use other places, where handlers are called back in all cases, and return error codes.  This keeps the utility functions generic, and easier to unit test in the future.

This is only used in one place.  Please inline these strings.

This reference has lifetime issues.  Please rearrange your code to remove it.  I suspect that the line on 2119 will be duplicated when you do this, and asyncResp is captured, but that's ok.

Calling this twice for the same handler is duplicating a dbus call.  The API of this should be updated to allow checking on more than one path at a time, otherwise this API will be even slower than it already is.
Done
